Articles.Content:
Hi,

i had to do it as long as the aero physics allow such things. i will present you the **S**ingle **S**tage **S**olar **S**ailing **S**hip **T**o **O**rbit "The Flying Dutchmann":

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/w9nzZ)

Action Groups:

1 - 18 Ion Engines

2 - 2 bottom Jet Engines

3 - 4 Jet Engines

4 - 2 central Jet Engines

0 - Solar Panels

610 Parts

i made a little video to show the takeoff to orbit process:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-o8T1b1NaZQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[http://www.filedropper.com/sssssto-flyingdutchmanniv](http://www.filedropper.com/sssssto-flyingdutchmanniv)

I am not pleasured by the handling of this craft, but i rebuild it serveral times from scratch and i have to stop working on it, befor i become mad. You have to tweak the jet engines a lot on the way to orbit, this is not beginner friendly. Turning rate is surprisingly good, but one moment of carelessness and it will spin out of control. Reentry with empty tanks is a problem too, but possible. Just be **realy** carefull. Fortunately the landing characteristics aren't that bad, but it tends to tip over the nose on braking when there is no cargo but lots of fuel in it. As you can see in the video, you have to "sail" cross like the real sailing ships, if you want some power.

In the video, you can see the start of a journey to Laythe with 10t of cargo. I do not know yet, if it is laythe capable. There is more than enough delta v in it, but its ion powered and that means i can't go the most efficient way. However, i will record the trip and post it, when i am back on Kerbin.

Some additional Heavy Metal:

![xdoi8jY.png](http://i.imgur.com/xdoi8jY.png)

This working dump truck is currently in the stomach of The Flying Dutchmann and will hopefully be delivered to Laythe.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-13T19:46:56Z" title="03/13/2015 07:46  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 13, 2015</time> by Adester**
Wait, wait, this thing ***WORKS?!*** Damn. Nicely done!

\*sees thread post\*

What? That is so not taking off.

\*sees video\*

....How?....When?....What magnificent wizardry is this?...

Amazing! And can go to orbit too?

That is awesome! Really like it!

Also, I laughed really hard when it took off. "Water? Nah, too mainstream. I want to fly!"

Amazing!

P.S.

How do those hinges on the dump truck work?

> 
> Wait, wait, this thing WORKS?! Damn. Nicely done!

> 
> \*sees thread post\*
> What? That is so not taking off.
> 
> \*sees video\*
> 
> ....How?....When?....What magnificent wizardry is this?...
> 
> Amazing! And can go to orbit too?
> 
> That is awesome! Really like it!
> 
> Also, I laughed really hard when it took off. "Water? Nah, too mainstream. I want to fly!"

> 
> Amazing!

Thanks for the nice replies, kerbonauts.

All Hail to the clipping god

> 
> P.S.How do those hinges on the dump truck work?

You probably had wobbely problems with rockets with many stages. I used a lot of the TR-2V Stack Decoupler. They have not much stability and allow parts to move around without breaking. I stacked them by connecting the upper points. The next one allowed me to use the lower connection points, then the upper again, and so on (my english is probably not good enough to explain this pictorially). The force to turn the load area comes from 4 O-10 MonoPropellant Engines. The 2 Mk1 Lander Cans provide the counter weight. There are 2 Stratus-V Cylindrified Monopropellant Tanks which will eventually deplete. But to be honest... there is no practically use for it and if there is one, the monopropellant will suffice for 30 - 50 dumps.

This is wonderful! I would like to see a kerbal at the helm on the outer deck. So he can feel the solar wind on his face. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

> 
> This is wonderful! I would like to see a kerbal at the helm on the outer deck. So he can feel the solar wind on his face. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

oh my god, why didn't i have this idea, there belongs a command seat.

> You probably had wobbely problems with rockets with many stages. I used a lot of the TR-2V Stack Decoupler. They have not much stability and allow parts to move around without breaking. I stacked them by connecting the upper points.

I understand, thanks!

Very. Damnn. GOOD.

PS Can we have the craft file for truck?

AAUUUWOO. GAAA. Leedleedleedlee. :'D

Great craft!
Drop sails, turn off SAS and set rudder t' hard starboard, we're goin' t' fire decouplers and boosters at t' Kraken!

> 
> PS Can we have the craft file for truck?

of course: [http://www.filedropper.com/kipper](http://www.filedropper.com/kipper)

Action Groub 6 for the dumpengines

But be aware, that it is something for the eyes since there is no much use for it in ksp.
I have NO idea how that is aerodynamically sound (and PLEASE don't give me the KSP physics are not sound BS, I am well aware of it)

> 
> I have NO idea how that is aerodynamically sound (and PLEASE don't give me the KSP physics are not sound BS, I am well aware of it)

the center of lift is way in front of the center of weight. with burning fuel, this becomes even worse. im curenntly working on a train with the same strange setup. these things souldn't fly... but, like the bumblebee, they don't know that and so they go on.

Gives a whole new meaning to solar sails.

KEEP GOING; YOU'RE GOOD, YOU'RE GOOD, YOU'RE GOOD, YOU'RE GOOD

Take some rep.

> Drop sails, turn off SAS and set rudder t' hard starboard, we're goin' t' fire decouplers and boosters at t' Kraken!

YES! The only thing this ship needs is MOAR MISSILES

\*sees takeoff video\*

Witchcraft.

\*sees rest of takeoff video\*

Oh, just turbojets.

This is probably the single awesomest build I've ever seen. Very well done.
Worst part is that it will probably not work in 1.0
Wow. Very original Design. Congrats Adester.

Great work man, im going to miss the stock aero ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Btw...

i still want to know who the KSP naysayer is, the person who votes all the thread on the exchange as terrible is getting annoying... this thread was at 3 stars before i voted on it, its easily a 6/5 star thread.

Its like trying to take off with a bloody battlecruiser (except the battlecruiser is actually somewhat stableish in terms of aerodynamics).
